 Duties:  
 Checking menu of store.  
 Prepare food items menu by ensuring both quality and quantity.  
 Ensure that food items are properly rotated in storage.  
 Order supplies before they run out of stock.  
 Overseeing the day-to-day store operations.  
 Ensure that food items are appropriately arranged on plates and platters.  
 Dispose of expired or near expiry products.  
 Ensure cleanliness of store by following sanitation guidelines.  
 Inspect food items and equipment on a constan t basis.  
 Report store malfunctions and manage limited repair work around the store.  
 Store food in an appropriate manner.  
 Manage food inventory and supplies.  
 Maintaining relationships with company suppliers through face -to-face meetings, phone 
calls, and emails.   
 Plan meals according to instructions.  
 Prepare and assemble portions in accordance to the menu.  
 Manage cash registers by taking payments.  
 Assist with food preparation services for catering projects.  
 Creating menus that are popular and profitable.   
 Maintaining the highest quality hospitality.  
 Providing direction and supervision to catering staff.  
 Conducting research to ascertain the best products and suppliers in terms of best value, 
delivery schedules and quality.  
 Purchasing the best quality of goo ds and services for a company at the most competitive 
price.
